SEARCH
Package com.serezk4

Class Main

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.Main
public final class Main extends Object
The entry point of the program.

The Main class initializes the application by setting up the required input/output workers and starting the Handler to manage the application logic. It employs a private constructor to prevent instantiation and delegates the logic to the run method.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • ConsoleWorker
  • DequeWorker

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      private Main()
      Private constructor to prevent instantiation.

      This class is intended to be used statically via the main(String[]) method.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String... args)
      The main method that starts the program.

      Calls the run(String...) method to initialize input and output workers and execute the application logic using Handler.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used in this program)

    • run

      private void run(String... args)
      Initializes the application and executes the main logic.

      Sets up a BufferedConsoleWorker for console input/output and a DequeWorker for managing script execution. Passes these workers to the Handler instance for managing the program's flow. Handles any exceptions by logging them to the error stream.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used in this program)
